Sephora Promo Codes: Updated November 7, 2014 Sephora is one of my favorite beauty and skincare stores. I prefer to order online to take advantage of the enticing promo codes, 3 free samples and 4-8% cashback from ebates or fatwallet. Like many savvy Sephora shoppers, I search for the best promo codes before I make an online purchase; however, this process can take a significant amount of time. So, to save you that time, I compiled all the working Sephora promo codes in this post! I listed these promo codes to the best of my ability, so please let me know if you notice any mistakes. Also, although I personally checked all of these codes at checkout, I can not guarantee that they will be in stock when you make your next purchase. In addition, I am not VIB Rouge, so I don't know if the listed VIB Rouge codes are still available. If you have any promo codes to share, or if any of the listed codes have expired, please let me know and I'll update the post. Check out my latest Thomas’ new book, The French Beauty Solution (Time-Tested Secrets to Look and ... lifetime commitment to routine is the opposite of our search for that instantly effective product or procedure. 
 
I tested a Caudalie product that illustrates this “integral” philosophy.  The Eau de Beaute Beauty Elixir (1oz travel-sized bottle: $18) is a toner/serum mist ... powder sets makeup for the day; a touchup spray or two gives skin an energized tingle (a byproduct of what Caudalie calls “microcirculation”).  Oily-skinned girls, don’t be scared by the essential oils—the ingredients are disinfecting, and help calm acne-prone skin.  The ... everyone already knows these things!  And now, thanks to The French Beauty Solution, so can we.

Monthly Empties: 1st Qtr 2014 Time to share what has been showing up in my Glossybox at the end of the month. Sadly it really has turned into quarterly empties post, but I'm working on it! January 2014 Monthly EmptyJanuary of 2014 was a pretty boring month. Only 3 items emptied out, but I finally finished my Shiseido White Lucent Brightening Moisturizing Emulsion (and yes this is the old packaging so you know how long it's been sticking around!)Shiseido White Lucent Brightening Moisturizing Emulsion  -  Retails for $59 and probably lasted me over 2 years with on and off inconsistent use. I've been using it as a night moisturizer only because even though it is very lightweight, I feel that it takes too long for it to absorb into my skin to use in the mornings. Normally I only have 10-15 mins to get dressed before I dabble on makeup and get ready for work and powder foundation does NOT go on well on a sticky surface. I switch to using it at night and it works wonderfully. Keeps my skin hydrated and plump the next day. I will definitely repurchase in the future because I really love the White Lucent line, but I think my skin has reach it's plateau with the line in terms of brightening, so I'm going to switch off to something else.The Body Shop - Body Butter in Olive - The larger 200 mL container retails for $20 (cheaper on Amazon). I got this as a gift for Xmas the previous year in 2012 and never got around using it because I thought the Olive scent smelled too masculine (something to keep in mind if you share with a significant other), but since I needed a new body lotion after showering (a habit that I've been keeping for the last year and half - works wonders!) I decided to use it up. The scent finally grew on me and I actually bought a back up already! Very hydrating to the skin and doesn't leave me feeling greasy at all after a shower.Neutrogena Naturals Lip Balm - Retails about $3 and was a freebie I received from the Target Style Summer Beauty Bag. Part of their all natural line that promotes products without use of crazy chemicals. Nothing really stood out for me, just a regular old clear lip balm and it didn't have a glossy finish like the Fresh Sugar Treatment. I think the one thing that was most memorable is the clear packaging. You can actually see the balm move up and down the tube and probably gave me the most incenitive to finish up. Will be an option for future purchase if I ever run into a drugstore for lip balms again. Now that was easy to wrap up January, but February was really when everything piled into the GlossyBox.February 2014 Monthly EmptiesGetting the repeats out of the way first.Shiseido White Lucent Brightening Emulsion is just the travel size of the one used above and the FaceQ Ocean & Aloe Mask was reviewed here. My opinion still stands.SK-II Facial Treatment Clear Lotion - Retails for $60 for the full size and is really a toner and not a lotion. It was intended for the oily T-zones (not that it is for oily skin). I put some on a cotton pad and then just wipe my entire face. Doesn't leave the skin feeling very plump (well it's a toner) so you definitely need a moisturizer afterwards. I prefer the Facial Treatment Essence over it.Aveeno Stress Relief Moisturizing Lotion - Body lotion that's suppose to relieve stress! Haha, yes I got sucked in and bought it. The only reason it helps relieve stress is because it has a lavender scent, which traditionally soothes and they expect you to only use this at night. The texture and consistency of this lotion differs from their regular line though. It's more lightweight and less hydrating.  I would stick to their regular line, I wasn't too crazy about the scent.  The 12 oz bottle retails about $10 and is available in any drugstore. H2O+ Spa Hand &Nail Cream - Finally finished this hand cream after years of use! Too lazy to use at home and it was too big to carry outside. Retails about $15 but have been discontinued. It wasn't bad at all. Very thick and left my hands feeling really silky.Missha The Style HD Viewer 270 Mascara - Professional Volume - I've reviewed it in detailed here before. The formula doesn't smudge and dries quickly on my lashes. It's already discontinued but I wouldn't repurchase this one anyway because the brush head was too big for my shaky, unsteady hands.Arganics by NuMe Argan Oil - This sample size came in my very first Glossybox and full size retails for $59. A very gooey hair serum that I dare not use on DRY hair because it would be too hard to spread in the ends of my hair evenly, but on damp hair, at least I was able to rub my palms on the ends. The scent was light but I didn't see much difference in my hair texture or shininess. Funny anecdote of the day, I was on a argan oil kick after using the Josie Maran Argan Oil Moisturizer, so what did I do when I saw this little bottle? Yup, I slathered the HAIR SERUM on my face! I'm lucky it didn't break me out. Took me over 4-5 times use on my face before I finally read

My Review of the Caudalie VineActiv Range I’ve never purchased any of Caudalie’s products as they are quite expensive, but I’ve always had a few of their products on my list of things to try. 
The SkinStore kindly offered to send me Caudalie’s new VineActiv range to try out. When I opened the box I was thrilled to see 4 full sized products from Caudalie. I wasn’t expecting that at all. 

Here’s what I received…
Caudalie VineActiv Glow Activating Anti-Wrinkle Serum 
Price: $52.00 for 30 ml
Caudalie VineActiv 3-in-1 Moisturiser 
Price: $44.00 for 40 ml 
Caudalie VineActiv Overnight Detox Oil
Price: $50.00 for 30 ml
Caudalie VineActiv Energizing and Smoothing Eye Cream
Price: $39.00 for 15 ml

I’ve been using the skin care line for about ... to help correct the intital signs of aging. It’s just what I need in my life.
Every morning I apply the Caudalie VineActiv Energizing and Smoothing Eye Cream around my eye area first. Then I apply the serum to my entire face and neck. After that soaks in I apply the Caudalie VineActiv 3-in-1 Moisturiser. 
Before bed I apply the eye cream and then the Caudalie VineActiv Overnight Detox Oil. If I feel like my skin needs some extra moisture then I will apply the Caudalie VineActiv 3-in-1 Moisturiser before the detox oil.
I got into the routine of applying my eye cream first when started ... out easily so wasn’t sure how the dry oil would work for me. 
My favourite product of the four is the Caudalie VineActiv Glow Activating Anti-Wrinkle Serum. I use it in the morning as I said and really feel that it brightens ... should let you know as I wouldn’t want it to happen to you. 
Until now I had no idea that Caudalie’s products were more “green”. It makes me even more interested in the brand. All of their products are free of…  ... are interested in trying the line you can find it at the SkinStore.

Caudalie VineActiv Glow Аctivating Anti-Wrinkle Serum, Caudalie VineActiv Energizing and Smoothing Eye Cream Новая гамма средств против морщин - Caudalie VineActiv для интенсивного ежедневного ухода за кожей, предназначена для девушек 25-35 лет и включает сыворотку, увлажняющее средство 3/1, крем для области вокруг глаз и губ, ночное масло.Caudalie VineActiv Glow Аctivating Anti-Wrinkle Serum - сыворотка-активатор на основе стабилизированных полифенолов, нейтрализует воздействие неблагоприятных факторов окружающей среды, разглаживает морщины и возвращает ... липкости. При утреннем использовании, под макияж мне достаточно только сыворотки - кожа становится эластичной, увлажненной, упругой, гладкой, свежей, с атласным свечением.Caudalie VineActiv Energizing and Smoothing Eye Cream - тонизирующий и разглаживающий крем уменьшает морщины и темные круги под глазами, разглаживает кожу вокруг ... очень нравится, как они увлажняются, становятся гладкими, без складочек. Такой миниатюрный и удобный формат отлично подходит для сумочки или дорожного багажа.Купить: Caudalie.ru

A linha French Kiss chega com cores irresistíveis e claro: com a assinatura da Caudalie: os polifenóis antioxidantes da semente da uva.

#1. Addiction (7.5g, R$ 69,00): tom ousado de vermelho framboesa. Oferece um toque sexy enquanto se ... realça os lábios naturais, enquanto oferece um acabamento leve e brilhante.

A coleção French Kiss já está disponível nas Boutiques Caudalie, no e-commerce da marca e nas lojas Sephora.

When I think of France, I think of delicious food, amazing wine, wonderful landscapes and an ever present sense ... on my parents as well. I guess it was only a matter of time that I’d discover French cult label Caudalie: the brand basically unites all that France is famous for in its products: naturalness, beauty and of course the grape.
 
What can I say, French women simply have great taste. I fell in love with Caudalie and its uncomplicated products straight away. A couple of years ago the coveted products were only available in France, which made Caudalie a bit of an insider’s tip abroad, but fortunately the brand is now also stocked in German pharmacies.
But what is the brand’s secret?

Mis 5 favoritos del mes – Enero 

Mascarilla Instant Détox de Caudalíe $39.00: Definitivamente una mascarilla desintoxicante que vale la pena sobretodo para pieles más grasas o con tendencia al acné. Ayuda a extraer las impurezas y toxinas que se acumulan en tus poros. Además verás cómo tu piel va recuperando su luminosidad gracias a sus componentes naturales como orujo de uva, arcilla rosa, café y enzimas de papaya. Dejar mascarilla por: 5 a 10 minutos. Frecuencia sugerida: 1 a 2 veces por semana. (Más info del producto aquí: )
Mascarilla Pollutant Defending de Kiehl’s $32.00: En México el cilantro es un ingrediente que se usa para sazonar muchas comidas deliciosamente! Quién diría que Kiehl’s lo combinaría con extracto de naranja para hacer esta mascarilla protectora? Úsala después de tu rutina de limpieza nocturna, para que ayudes a tu piel a sentirse fortalecida contra los contaminantes del medio ambiente y a prevenir impurezas. Dejar mascarilla por: 5 minutos. Frecuencia sugerida: 3 veces por semana. (Más info del producto aquí: )
Mascarilla Hidratante de Avène $26.00: Con tanta resequedad de la época nunca está de más mantener la piel bien hidratada. Esta mascarilla con aceite de cártamo es ideal para pieles secas, ya que su principal objetivo es nutrir e hidratar el cutis de manera profunda. Dejar mascarilla por: 10 a 15 minutos. Frecuencia sugerida: 1 a 2 veces por semana (dependiendo de tu tipo de piel). (Más info del producto aquí: )
Mascarilla Hidratante para Contorno de Ojos de Tatcha $12.00: Si estamos hablando de cuidarnos la cara no podemos olvidar cuidar el contorno de ojos! La fórmula de esta mascarilla esta enriquecida con algas rojas de Okinawa y extracto de peonías lo que permite revitalizar e hidratar el contorno de ojos y reducir la apariencia de líneas finas de expresión. Dejar mascarilla por: 15 minutos. Frecuencia sugerida: De 1 a 2 veces por mes. (Más info del producto aquí: )
Mascarilla Reafirmante Gravitymud de Glamglow $69.00: Para las que ya tienen 30 años o más, esta mascarilla les va a encantar. Lo que hace es reafirmar y tonificar la piel de tu rostro, cuello y escote cuando ya tienes síntomas de flacidez, y si eres de las afortunadas que aún no lo presenta, te ayuda a prevenirlo! Dejar mascarilla por: 20 a 30 minutos. Frecuencia sugerida: 2 veces por semana. (Más info del producto aquí: )
